why_choose: Why choose this course? Theory and practice with contemporary developments Elective/ specialisation options Service-learning/ Rural exposure visits Mini-projects/ Dissertation/ Internships Student exchange with foreign universities Joint publications
what_learn: What you will learn? Societal structures, cultural diversity, and social dynamics. Economic theories, principles, and market dynamics. Research methodologies and data analysis. Interdisciplinary problem-solving and critical thinking. Application of knowledge in diverse fields, such as policy analysis, and financial consulting.
modules: Modules Introduction to Political Science Introductory Microeconomics Foundations of Sociology-I Year 1 Classical Social Theories Foundations of Sociology-II Introductory Macroeconomics Indian Government and Politics Intermediate Microeconomics Study of Indian Society Gender and Sexuality Holistic education Year 2 Sociology of Indigenous societies Comparative Politics History of Economic Thought Public Economics Sociology of Development Year 3 Media and Society (Elective) Indian Economy International Economics Sociology of Health and Illness (Elective) Sociology of Religion (Elective) Research Methodology in Economics (or) Advanced Social Theories Environmental Economics (or) Social Ecology Year 4 Urban Economics (or) Urban Sociology labour Economics (or) Sociology of Development Social Ecology Crime and Deviance Advanced Social Theories Sociology of Science and Technology
career: Career prospects Teaching and Research: Graduates can become educators or researchers, contributing to academic institutions and advancing knowledge. Corporate Sector: They are equipped for roles in marketing, HR, and management, applying analytical skills to enhance business strategies. Developmental Sector: Graduates can work for NGOs or non-profits, addressing social issues and fostering positive change in communities. Government Sector: Opportunities in policy analysis and public administration allow graduates to shape government decisions. Market Research: They can excel in market research, analysing consumer behaviour and market trends for businesses. Financial Consulting: With economic expertise, they can offer financial consultancy services to individuals and organisations, aiding in financial planning and decision making.
